# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt, bump = 3)
    if isa(dt, Date)
        throw(ArgumentError("Function supports DateTime, not Date."))
    elseif isa(dt, DateTime)
        return dt + Hour(bump)
    else
        throw(ArgumentError("Input must be of type Date or DateTime.")))
    end
end
```
This function checks the input type and applies the time zone adjustment accordingly. It throws an error if the input is not a `Date` or `DateTime`. By default, it adds 3 hours to the provided timestamp.
